repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into series by year beginning with 1980, in addition to having a series devoted to web crawls.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Tufts Daily, founded in 1980, is the daily undergraduate student newspaper for Tufts University. Its mission is to provide a source of news for the Tufts community, a forum for the exchange of ideas, and a means for students to gain experience in journalism. It covers university news, sports, and events as well as some national and international news. It also includes editorials, a calendar of events, and syndicated comics. Published and distributed free of charge on class days during the academic year, the Tufts Daily is student-run and receives no financial support from Tufts University.
Particularly valuable are the Tufts Daily photographs documenting campus life - the people, places, events, and activities of Tufts University.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is processed and open for research.
Web sites were crawled by Archive-It. Web crawl information updated in finding aid annually.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues of the Tufts Daily, the daily, student-run newspaper of Tufts University. The Tufts Daily covers university news, sports, and events as well as national and international news taken from wire services. It also includes editorials, announcements and calendar items of events (primarily on the Medford campus), and nationally syndicated comics.

Each volume covers one semester, except for volume 7, which includes the entire calendar year 1983. Individual issues are often mis-labeled on the masthead. The mistakes can include incorrect volume, number or date statements. Issues until Spring 1994 are bound. Reference copies are available in the Archives reading room. A headline index is available electronically (from 1985) and in a card file (from 1980) in the archives reading room.
The collection also includes web crawls of the paper's web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tufts Daily, 1980 -- 2021. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

scopecontent.head: Content Warning
scopecontent.p: This finding aid contains language that may be offensive or outdated. Because such language is in titles or direct transcription of published materials, it has not been changed. Keeping this language intact provides the most accurate depiction of the creators' intent, and can potentially tell us important things about bigotry and bias on the part of the creators, or in a particular historical context. It can also preserve terms formerly applied by a group to self-identify that have since fallen out of common usage. For more information on DCA's content warning policy please visit our website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Quarterly web crawls of the Tufts Daily website crawled by DCA, as part of the Student Organizations web collection, to document the presesence of Tufts University student organizations on the web.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: To see all of websites crawled as part of the Student Organizations web collection, please visit https://archive-it.org/collections/6387

scopecontent.p: Local male confesses involovement in attack. Manning third in 400 at all-new englands [women's track].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Jazz show will feature Sonny Rollins. Tufts custodians accuse UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] of harrassment. Human rights activist gives talk. Tufts [men's] basketball season ends in a tight ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] quarterfinal battle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First phase of Pearson construction complete. Grad students upset with Tufts Connect organize a discussion. Phi Beta Kappa distinction will be awarded on April 28. [James] Lavallee makes it to top of running world. Skidmore ends Jumbos' [ice hockey] season. Men's swimming hoping to make splash at New England's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Arthur] Sulzberger to receive award from Senators. Daily beats "weakly". Women [swimming and diving] finish the season strong.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arts and Sciences faculty votes on course changes for next semester. TCU [Tufts Community Union] Senate approves new committee name. Help Tufts take a bite out of crime. Tufts makes bid to host Women's World Cup tournament in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Health Services takes small steps in providing greater health care. Tufts blood runs in his veins. Men's swimming make splash at New Englands, finishes third.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memorial Service held yesterday. UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] hopes to extend its contract. Economics Dept. may establish program in business/economics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Ancy] Verdier expects constitution to be completed at next Senate meeting. Freshman commits suicide while home. Inconsistancy plagued women's hoops throughout the year. Maybe next year will be different [men's hockey].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Men's lacrosse to play in Colorado. Crew teams compete in the championships.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Connect holds meeting with Senate to discuss high phone rates. Senate votes passage of revised constitution. Champion of a new Tufts minor. Uncertain future for softball.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Environmental Forum coming this weekend. Delaney says administration ordered "Sources" thrown out.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professor Couch will be recipient of award for teaching and advising. Manning sprints her way to championship. Jumbo baseball makes its pitch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Experimental College "Opens up The Classroom" in mock seminar. University plans new construction projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Panel to discuss future international relations. Students may soon use points to buy food at off-campus locations. Colorado trip proves successful for men's lacrosse in four games. [women's lacrosse] Jumbos 'black' out the Maroons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Somerville residents will discuss ethnic issues with Tufts students. Hodgdon will serve as carry-out facility. Young Baseball Jumbos ranked in New England after 4-5 trip South.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: George Clinton and the Violent Femmes to play Spring Fling. Finalists for Wendell Phillips award speak. Residential Life discusses lottery for co-ops in Hillside, Latin Way. Waxman gives lecture. Course credits not reflection of course difficulty. 11th Annual Student Forum- Beyond the Classroom.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report finds significant drops in faculty within the social sciences. Deans chose winners for leadership awards. Casino night for financial aid friday. Artsy events abound this weekend at Tufts. Offense sputters in a loss to Amherst team (Men's Lacrosse). Training is done for mens crew (Men's Crew)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Casino night a financial success, efforts to procure speaker failing. Speaker talks about modern Israeli politics. Tufts says goodbye to a professor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Racial tension topic of Faculty discussion. Fletcher Roundtable hosts panel discussion on UN improvements. Men's lacrosse falls short. Jumbos provide cards with 18-7 thrashing (women's lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Trustee may have conflict of interest. Author Lord to deliver speech to Class of '96. Safety shuttle needed for weekends. Past Tufts executive Lambert dead at 64. Pitching fine in wins [softball]. Jumbos win thriller at BC, 12-11 (softball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gill leads a panel for day without violence. Tufts Democrats' student voter registration drive ending today. Rollins treats Tufts to great jazz. Riders head to Nationals in L.A. (Equestrian). Crew drops a pair to Dartmouth Big Green (Men's Crew).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Elections Board announces days for Senate elections, referendum. Awards to be given on April 16. Tufts Hawaii Club held second annual luau on Saturday night. Jumbos cruise through weekend (baseball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DiBiaggio meets with press, defends trustee. Percentage of students admitted decreases with class of 2000. Expressing dissatisfaction with Tufts Connect. 'Take back the night', to be held on quad, protects women's rights. A Tufts senior's label releases charming 'Punky's dilemma' ( Peter Green). Trinity wins big over Tufts,10-3 ( Men's Lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jesse Jackson speaking at Tufts next Tuesday. Faculty toughens add/drop policy. 'Times' publisher Sulzberger honored by Senate yesterday. Medical center in fiscal trouble, says DiBiaggio. Too tough to 'Bear' (Women's Lacrosse). Track cools off the competition (men's track). Fall and Summer 1996 courses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Faculty, students debate race relations at Monday's forum. Senate prepares to conclude its year next week. Faculty award created. Men's Lacrosse loses big to Bowdoin. Jumbos win two, lose two (Women's softball). School of the Museum of Fine Arts and Tufts University Studio Art courses, Fall 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Barnes and Noble out next year? Veal cut from dining menus. Residentail hall association holds Quality of life forum. Students explore Cuban politics. A mixed bag for crew (Men's Crew). Sailing successful in home meet (sailing). Track places third at frigid ellis (women's track0.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ne re-entry at Spring Fling. Pedestrian hit by car outside Curtis Hall. Proposed Constitution to include several changes from '81 version. Hillel sponsoring Holocaust vigil. Jumbos split four over weekend (Baseball). Men's lacrosse runs out of gas in the fourth again and pays for it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Culture and commuter reps voted on at this week's TCU [Tufts Community Union] referendum. Generald Senate elections cancelled. Spring comedy show to feature sitcom star. Jesse Jacson lecture postponed due to poor weather in St. Louis. Cycling pedals towards eastern (Cycling). Start of losing streak following second loss? ( Women's Lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Forum questions career planning. Senate holds last meeting of term. Fawaz gives talk on conflict in Lebanon. A strong asset to his department ( Jonathan Strong). Men's track drops first ever home dual meet at ellis Oval. Softball team defeats Corsairs (and snow).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Forty freshmen blocked out of housing. Constitutional vote may be thrown out. Tuftonians celebrate JumboFest. Anti-gay graffiti found in Carmichael Hall again. Plans for Curtis coffeehouse being finalized. Tufts engineers go for cruise. Lax drops third home game (Men's Lacrosse). Tufts crew performs well on frigid Charles (Women's Crew). Williams wins easy over Jumbos (Men's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senators announce candidacies for president. Culture reps. to remain voteless. Tufts professor speaks about relationship between religion and politics in U.S. history. Tufts band's debut album is admirable. Lima wins three over weekend (softball, Michelle Lima).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meal plans to include altered point systems. Anthropology 10 is removed from list of accepted World Civ courses. Students discuss ethnic and racial issues on campus. Baseball team in the drivers seat. Men lack hustle in loss to Colby (men's Lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Friedman, Krause hold debate for Presidency. Students protest service of Tufts Connect during rally. Fling act replaced, conflict suspected. Candidates for TCU [Tufts Community Union] president discuss issues in interview. Graduate student dead. Spring fling will be in Philly and Amherst for the men's track team. On rebound, jumbos make run for playoffs (Women's Lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Friedman wins in questionable election. Somerville court convicts graffiti vandals. Six freshman form new fraternity. Virginia Drachman professes her love for women's history(Faculty Profile). Softball unbeaten after five games.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts crime stats released. Election may be contested by senior. Affirmative action topic of discussion on Wednesday. Cycling gears up for Regionals on campus. Racketeers on a roll, hope for playoff success (Men's tennis). Golfers fight weather for successful matches (Golf).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: University must still decide on UNICCO [University Cleaning Company]. 6000 infected with the funk. RE-DO! Report on faculty appointments to be addressed during summetr. Jesse Jackson speaks tonight. Add/Drop options reveal greater problem. TUTV [Tufts University Television] produces new soap opera. Men's track finished second in NESCAC [New England Schools and Colleges Athletic Conference] Championships. Taglienti ties strike record (baseball). Lax drops two games ( Women's lacrosse). Softball ends regular season well. Semester in review-Spring 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "There is nothing like a dream to create the future"--Victor Hugo. Tufts graduates honored with degrees today. History chair Fawaz named Dean of Arts and Humanities. Jesse Jackson speaks on American race relations. Wu steps down to new role as assistant dean. Faculty to review ROTC [Reserve Officers' Training Corps] in Fall. Students can receive semester grades by calling 1-800 number. Campus construction will continue this summer. Outgoing, incoming TCU [Tufts Community Union] Presidents discuss Senate. Saying goodbye to some Tufts personalities. O'Dair moves to MIT. Young Jumbos take ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] tourney (Baseball). Manning reaches goal: US 400 title (Shawntell Manning). 'Too little too late' ends it for lax (women's lacrosse). Lax team cant score, end hard season 5-10 (men's lacrosse). Softball finds success this season. Black leaves after record career (Rebecca Black). Keeping track of running champs Manning, Northrop (women's track). Onofrio's departure hurts both his team and his school (Bob sheldon-men's basketball). Alumni Relations-Special Section.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Class of 2000 matriculates today. Landmark sent out for maintenance. A new chapter. Teenage girl hit by train near campus. Professor Sullivan brings Machiavelli to Tufts. Orientation isnt the only drama at tufts this week. Radio-free tufts? Not necessarily. Sophomores spark football team. Walk-ons Dennis, Vriavas, MacLellan star for Jumbos (soccer).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senator stops to campaign on Quad. Tufts has best fund-raising year ever. University in top 20 for activism. Senators aiming to register student voters. Quest for success: Field hockey future looks bright. Success for soccer? Experimental College-Fall 1996 course listing and Info sheet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lezberg resigns as Senate treasurer. DiBiaggio to decide fate of Pepsi products on campus. Football season looks up for young Jumbos. Runners hope to step up to elite (Men's X-country). Revenge, Williams on mind of volleyballers. T isch Library: 60 Minute Computer workshops.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts ranks 22nd in magazine survey. Houston water shut off for day. Hodgdon dining offers meals for takeout at lunch, dinner. Health services improving image. New safety programs created after survey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Krause leaves Senate to pursue position as trustee rep. Two more quit Senate. Theater groups feel ignored in coffeehouse construction. Slew of new runners boosts hope for year (women's cross country). Women are in tip-top shape (women's soccer). Jumbos must battle inexperience (women's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Connect still has problems. No plans to improve safety of intersection. Soccer strikes out (Men's soccer). Number one ranked sailors were 'wicked fast'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decision on Pepsi expected in a week. Grad residents say bathrooms left filthy. Tomorrow's women engineers. Women show its a new year (Women's soccer).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Culture reps' vote on ballot for Fall elections. Ballou renovations to continue through this November. Aremenian diplomat lectures on peace in his region. Students enthusiastic but uninvolved in election '96. Volleyball falls short in street fight opener against Engineers (Women's Volleyball). Quest '96 opens with presents (Field Hockey).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kerry entrance surprises Weld at Monday debate. Off-campus points set to begin Nov.1. Senators ponder resolution on Pepsi. Tufts' best accident. Soccer comes back with win (men's soccer). Field hockey storms over Division II rival. Fleet-footed freshman facilitates first-place finish for X-Country (women's cross country).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administration denies Classics Professor Trout tenure. Fawaz named as new Dean. Preseident puts off PepsiCo. Team wins despite wierd happenings (men's cross country). Women's soccer team is on a roll.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts' television station given two large grants. Religion Dept. to add two new tenured professors. Task force being formed to investigate race relations. Week 1: Tufts vs. Wesleyan (football). Men's soccer team defeats Curry 5-0. Tufts volleyball goes the distance for Tues. 3-2 win . MITengineers a wet win over the jumbos (women's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tempers flare over Disco Inferno tickets. Sizing up candidates for President on the issues. New gym to be done soon. Jumbos lose season opeing heartbreaker (football). Sun shines on the undefeated (field hockey). Women's soccer gets ugly win.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Crew teams rowing in sewage - filled Charles. Baker to address Gulf conflict. Vriavas scores two in a win (men's soccer). Tennis smashes Colby and Smith (women's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bathroom vandals vause $10 thousand in damage. Jumbos spike Ephs (volleyball). Elephant men capture Snowball Classic with win over Penn State (men's ultimate frisbee). Tufts comes back to run past Bates and MIT (men's cross country).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Computer store closing. Pepsi on defensive at Senate meeting. Tufts sails away to victory (sailing). Runners winning in meets, polls (women's cross country). TCU [Tufts Community Union] Senate Elections '96.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Freshman Senators elected. New Dean faces students' difficulties with advising. Fulbright program awards Tufts' best. Upbeat Jumbos shut out by Amherst (women's tennis). NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] titans clash (field hockey). Golf team shows lots of talent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program aims to beautify campus. Kennedy proposes law to curb college alcohol abuse. Win comes in tale of two halves (football). Then there was one (field hockey). Zeros prove lucky number for men not women (men's soccer). Women lose the battle of soccer unbeatens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Religion Chair Hunter announces retirement. EPIIC [Education for Public Inquiry and International Citizenship] program connects Tufts and high school students. Jumbos split at MIT Invite (volleyball). Injured tennis team drops two matches against healthier foes (women's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drive to register voters set for today. Campuslink solves 'crosstalk' problem. Jumbos wreck WPI (field hockey). Men run well, finish fourth at challenging Cortland Invitational (men's cross country). Dissapointment for runners at codfish (women's cross country).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cable rates hiked. Tisch library to implement overdue policies for faculty. Jumbos rebound against Wellesley (women's soccer). Host Jumbos win Hood Trophy (sailing).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: University must address backlog of $42 million in deferred campus maintenance. TCU [Tufts Community Union] Senate sets goals for year during annual retreat. Tufts proud of higher ranking. Ice cold Bowdoin Polar Bears will host Jumbos [football). Tufts women lose now leaving the team record 2-5 (women's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two students assaulted by group of students. Fire breaks out at AEPi [Alpha Epsilon Pi]. Probe links Tufts students' death to protein drink. DiBiaggio announces decision: Tufts sticks with Pepsi, for now. Lowly Polar Bears eat up Jumbos (football).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Steve Tisch, other alumni will discuss their careers in media. Forced triples avoided by Res Life in August. Senate explores way to inprove freshman experience. Volleyball sweeps Bates tounament. Bowdoin roadblock the first setback in Quest '96 (Field hockey).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tenure process draws support and criticism. Early admissions applications on the rise. Mid week victory lacks Jumbos usual intensity (Women's soccer). Elephant men continue quest for the ellusive Ultimate Beanpot title (Men's Ultimate Frisbee). Jumbo harriers run away with victory at Babson Invitational (Men's X-country).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The library that Tisch built: Dedication today. First meeting for freshmen senators. Physics department is ranked 19th in nation. Sailing in the right direction (sailing). Pattern continues for tennis team (women's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two years and $21 million later, the Tisch library is now official. Tisch and other alums discuss media careers. Anthro 10 will fulfill World Ci. requirement. Tufts to give it a try at trinity (Football). Team makes strides towards Nationals (Equestrian).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two suspended for breaking and entering, theft in Tilton. University alumnus runs for Mass. seat in Congress. Tufts Medical School involved in several research projects. First-half collapse again (Men's football). Rowers start to find stroke (Crew).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tenure decision reversed. Jumbo notes make skipping easier. DiBiaggio discusses safety with senators. Physics chair trying to attract student interest in department. Gamsby: Stopping 'em cold (men's soccer). Graham-less team is almost golden in meet (men's cross country). 'Walking wounded' enjoy a week off, nagging injuries plaque team (women's cross country). Make it nine in a row: Volleyball "getting the job done".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts student suspended for burglary. DiBiaggio receives top pay raise. More troubles for doubles (women's tennis). Homecoming King, Queen nominees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Special sports pull out: homecoming '96. Eight homeless after fire on Electric Ave. Administrators rethink tenure appeals process. Tufts Daily Alumni reunion '96. Jumbos long shot in Saturday's centerpiece [Football]. Goalie Gamsby ready to take place among greats. This is what its all about (women's hockey). Volleyball away on Jumbos' day. Crew goes to the head of the pack.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stratton rooms are flooded after storm. TCCS head Morris resigns his position. Tufts Homecomg 1996.Jumbos lose in last seconds (women's soccer). Outcome is deja vu for team (Men's soccer). Despite fighting hard, luck not is on Tufts' side (football).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senator declares Zamboni article racially offensive. Panel addresses realtionship between faculty and students. Tibetan Freedom Tour comes to Tufts today. Winning streak end after ten (Volleyball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts: Minority hiring better than most schools. Resolution calls for increase in African-American enrollment. Northrop record highlights meet (Men's X-Country). Tufts'engineers' win over a midiocre rival (Men's soccer). Tennis looks towards NESCAC's [New England Schools and Colleges Athletic Conference, women's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Computer store manager talks about his store's losses, closing. Jumbos book the Judges (women's volleyball). Stormy weekend on the waters (sailing).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Community's complaints about off campus students on the rise. Morse code heads Jumbos. Jumbos look to end their [football] losing streak at Amherst.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Student Stabbed in Gym fight. Panelists say slavery is still a reality in the third world. Class brings Japanese to elementary schools. Perseus project expands library to include Rome. Jumbos like to play games, too. "Hostage" actors capture audience. Jumbos [football] are no match for Amherst Lord Jeffs. Volleyball wins three, but loses match to second-ranked Springfield college.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate passes quality of life resolution unanimously. Rubella warnings are distributed around campus. Staus of ROTC [Reserve Officers' Training Corps] discusses by faculty. REAL program providing education to older students. Saturday's tale of two [field hockey] teams. Respectable tenth place for [women's] tennis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Union protests Ballou mason. [Bill] Stackman takes job as associate dean at Oberlin. James Baker and stupid pet tricks. Coffeehouse construction begins in Curtis this week. United Nations, Tufts join forces on environmental study program. League finish boosts chance for [men's cross country] nationals. [men's soccer] Jumbos take to road for a win. Crew closes out season at MIT/Tufts regatta.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DiBiaggio says raise is 'grossly miscalculated'. James Baker lectures on Middle East peace. Dead Sea scrolls discussed. Halloween havoc in the hill. Jumbos maul bears in [volleyball] home finale. Healthy [women's cross country] performance. 'Above average' sailing weekend. En garde [fencing]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2,000 parents expected for weekend festivities. Students fall for salon scam. Upcoming 'imaginative' lecture series discusses human freedom. Tufts looking for a win in final home [football] game of season. This year's New England [Rugby] champs?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Democrats will offer a shuttle bus to polls. Investigation into Lezberg credit card dropped. Tufts alumnus sculpts Mayer bust for library. Errors cost Jumbos a win in final home game of [football] season. Jumbos [football] lose in ugly game. Goalie is a 'star' at stopping opponents. Mathey, Morris leading the way.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: At last, it is all up to the voters. Senators introduce resolution on safety. Women's studies Director will 'challenge the system'. At least there was Bates [football]. ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] bids arrive for two teams. E-women [frisbee] rebuilding for spring. Weekend romp! [women's volleyball]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Racial Slurs spur another fight between students, locals. EPIIC [Education for Public Inquiry and International Citizenship] tackles outward bound. [Men's] Cross Country wins big at ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] meet. Tie leaves post season in doubt for men's soccer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Trustees add gays to diversity statement. Phone bill due dates confuse students. Ex college forum explained election. Tufts to host US-Israeli affairs seminar Sunday. Jumbos [women's soccer] kick away pioneers. Tufts [hockey] dogs Huskies in OT.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Policy on guests not changing, police say. Points off campus delayed. Library late night study extended. Seniors feel the pressure. [Women's cross country] Rested and ready. [volleyball] team makes a comeback. Novices look to feed varsity [crew]. Sailors are edged out in the Victorian Urn. Men are tops in New England [Rugby] this season. Jumbos travel to Middlebury hoping to win in [football] season finale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cracker signed for fall show. Senior says he was wrongly suspended for 1994 mail fraud. AIPAC [American Israel Public Affairs Committee] panel discusses election fallout. Tufts wins two ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] titles, receives three NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] berths. Oxfam America will host annual Fast for World harvest campaign. Tufts supershow was super cool. Psycho beach party promises gender bender beachy fun. Jumbos end their disappointing football season with sixth straight defeat. Women take ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] [soccer] championship in OT. Storybook ending for field hockey. [men's soccer] Jumbos return to the dance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate wants to increase public safety on campus. TCU [Tufts Community Union] registration drive leaves some freshmen voteless. Professor relieved after being cleared in research fraud case. Volleyball wins league, earns bid to NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] tournament. [Men's] Cross country reached new heights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Faculty discusses election. Boston Ave. brawls go to second round. E-men edged by harvard [men's ultimate frisbee]. Sailing team drops in rankings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oxfam to raise awareness of World hunger with fast. Panel discusses media's representation of youth. Following campaigns and elections with Prof. Glaser. 'Twilight' is a modern day masterpiece. America East championship comes on Sat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four arrested for theft, assault at campus party. Hillside residents discuss security. Fraternity hoping to create escort service. Inside Tufts dining: nutritious and delicious? Fantasy leagues: Where you get to pretend you're a GM.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Strange series of events in Hillside reported to Police. Senate discusses campus safety, upcoming coffeehouse. Speech inspires formation of Tufts Anti-slavery Coalition. Season ends as Coast Guard sails over Jumbos in NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association, volleyball]. Jumbos [men soccer] booted out of first round.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Study shows alcohol is doubly hard on young. Joe Kennedy to speak to students on campus. Turkey shuttle tix on sale. Jumbos shoot for NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association, men's basketball] tourney without Chad. Women set to tip off season against Regis. Women's swim team ready to make a splash. Northrop leads cross country at Nationals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 24-hour hunger fast ends today. Cracker rushes through fall show, anxious to leave behind rowdy fans. Economists hold panel on Eastern Europe, Asia. Next for Bowdler: informed students. Jumping into [riding] postseason. Season ends strong as co-ed sailing team wins last regatta of '96. Untried Tufts Hockey ready to lace 'em up. [men's and women's Track:] Revamped Jumbos ready to come out of the blocks, On their mark, Jumbos set to got far this season.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CSL [Committee on Student Life] denies student appeals. Organizer of trip to Cuba may face US legal charges. Engineering lab supervisor has pride in ties to students. "Falsettos" is a touching play that audience members can relate to. [Men's swimming] Jumbos ready to splash into upcoming campaign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plan aims to improve communication. Campus forum addresses freedom to travel to Cuba.Cooperation made hunger Awareness week a success. Season- opening win gives Jumbos a 'beacon' of hope [women's basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bernstein addresses Senate resolutions. Local University police discuss how to improve campus safety. Take-Home HIV test hits store shelves for convenience. Institute of medicine advocates national education about STDs. Hockey opener against Fairfield concluded in a traditional 4-4 tie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Men's swimming] Jumbos splash to win over Cougars in first meet of the year. Women's swimming starts season off strong.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Junior held for Stabbing of 3 at party. M&M combination capture all american honors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In unanimous vote, the faculty cuts reading period to two days. Pharcyde to play at Tufts this weekend. Class organizes symposium on reproduction and environment. [Pat] Skerry-less Jumbos falls to Panthers after opening [men's basketball] win. Promising 2-1 start for Women [basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rep. Joseph Kennedy to Speak today. Student arrested for raid on Berkshire mink ranch. Senate hopes to expand shuttle hours. Bridge lets students, faculty mix.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poli-Sci department breaks top 20. Half a million designated for residence hall improvements. Joe Kennedy addresses voter apathy. Medical school names Harrington as new dean. Snowboarding Club prepares for winter. Tufts grad Al- Muttawa will lecture on bouncy best seller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts mourns the loss of sophomore. Ballou renovations near an end. Coffeehouse to open Jan. 15. Surprisingly speedy Jumbos easy [women's swimming] victors. [men's swimming] Bobcats the Victims as Jumbos succeed. Poor execution leads to big hockey defeat against rivals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The object ID for this issue does not reflect its current location because it was ingested before a paper copy was found, October, 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains issues of the Tufts Daily, the student newspaper of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record number apply to Tufts. Glassner ordered held for evaluation. Slow start hurts rusty [hockey] Jumbos. Jumbos upset tenth ranked Buffalo St., win Basketball tournament.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dining Services puts points off campus again. Brown n' Brew open despite license delay. Hospital merger ends uncertainty for Medical School. Tufts students will travel to Tahiti for peace conference. Camels smoke Jumbos, hand [women's basketball] team their fourth straight loss. Team representatives cost others chances for All Star [hockey] Game glory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bridge project still not done. Fire Marshal warns halogens may be unsafe. Library purchase budget doubles in four-year period. Strong inside game leads Jumbos [men's basketball] over Middlebury. Lyons feast on Tufts [women's basketball]. Tufts Hockey team continues to slide amidst recent defeats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Bill] Richardson nominated ambassador to UN. Friedman delivers State of the Senate address, speaks of plans. More than java's waiting for you at the new Brown n' Brew. New Service Organization begins. New year squashes [squash] Jumbos. Women Jumbo runners finish with strong second. [Women's basketball] Losing streak ends with victory over Wesleyan. Tufts swimming leaves engineers in their wake.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TUTV [Tufts University Television] set to broadcast on campus within two weeks. Nobel Prize nominees discuss Serbia protests. War-time accountability. Second win [for women's basketball] signals gaining momentum. Bantams feel Jumbos' wrath [men's basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senators hope to survey students about concerns. Emerald upgrade will enhance speed. Henry Owens resigns, leaving vacancy on judiciary. Climb is too steep to playoffs [for men's hockey].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TBAG celebrates Pepsi's decision. Fraternities welcome pledges to rush. Wiring blamed in off campus blaze. Improving Life for women. Eat at pound to participate in weekly raffle for movie tickets. Top ranked cougars pounce all over Jumbos [women basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Treasury reveals $334,500 surplus. Task Force on race wants input at forum tonight. Alum nominated for Nobel Peace prize. Two victories this weekend [women's swiming]. Final 200 meter is a winner [men's swimming]. Jumbos [cross country] race past their rivals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate shows lack of accountability. Forum held on planet's future. Lecture builds up the central artery project. Memorial service for Jayne Novotny to be held this sunday. Novotny's friends mourn her sudden loss. Medford star takes Tufts basketball team by storm. Jumbos win thriller in 2 OT after massive defeat to Clark [women's basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TCUJ [Tufts Community Union Judiciary] expands powers. Senior fund to provide for incoming freshman. Tufts employee awarded for amazing AIDS work. Electronic grade reporting was popular. Tale of two halves in loss (Women's basketball). Tufts 'Rams' Suffolk with five men in double figures (Men's basketball). Grand Opening week.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senators OK class council appeal. Shrinking student body causes deficit. Surplus is key in Treasury Address. Stein leads wave of success (men's swimming). Tufts shows team effort in win (Women's swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abroad applications rising, more participants than ever. Coffeehouse succeeding. Purple cows destroy Tufts (women's basketball). Jumbos beat beavers alive (men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marsalis to perform in Jazz concert. Nobel winner will speak to students. Scientists to lecture Sunday. Therrian stings Jumbos (hockey). Short track no obstacle for men (Men's track). Tufts women run past Bowdoin (women's track).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Student coalition to call for responsible investment policies. Tuition will be endorsed. Jumbos can walk the walk (men's swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grad says UN in 'deep crisis'. Five students competing to join judiciary. Nobel laureate says belief systems dictate behavior. Women clinch victory with 14 point comeback (Women's basketball). Magic man strikes again (Men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senators introduce contract with Tufts. Housing lottery to change for students going abroad. Skerry named Tufts athelete on the month (Pat Skerry-basketball). Williams overwhelms Jumbos (Women's swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Policy suggested on discrimination. Housing availability will not be a problem. Jumbos hang on for victory over Nicholas(men's hockey).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Protest against trustee held outside Ballou. Fund-raising campaign reaches 49 percent of $400 million goal. Runners qualify for Division III (men's track). Unscored Smith invite proves preductive (women's track). Weekender.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Economics Department searching for new hires. Paige hall will be renovated shortly. Freshman [Drew] Carleton powers hockey team past Wesleyan (men's hockey). Jumbos fall to UMass squad (men's basketball). Loss does not end tournament hopes (men's swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Panel addresses energy issues. More apply to Tufts, less to the Ivy's. Not this time. History prof. Ueda tries to influence his students. One strong half is never enough (women's basketball). Tufts Vs. Williams: The Rivalry (men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TCU [Tufts Community Union] senators give updates on committees. Provost Gittleman plans to distribute free newspapers to dorms next year. Tufts grad Richardson takes on new challenge at UN. Jumbos excell, then unravel(hockey). On heals of thrashing Regis, team looks to New Englands(Women's swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reitman discusses disciplinary verdicts. First merchant set to accept points Monday. TCUJ [Tufts Community Union Judiciary] elections held today. Shuttle will run on weekends. Roof ripped from South Hall. Jumbos ran well in championships (men's track and field).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Officials assess damage after wind rips roof off. Despite commotion, students handle situation well. Judiciary seat filled. Memorial service for Buttrick on Sunday. Jumbos fall prey to dominant Bobcat team (women's basketball). Freshmen lead pack (women's track). Ragsdale beats the buzzer (men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A cappella groups question choice to recognize sQ. Descendents of both sides os Holocaust to speak together. Breen was 'out for blood' and drew it from Gators (women's basketball). Jumbos pull off upset against White Mules.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: B&G [Buildings and Grounds] creates new area maintenance system. Senior class council receives morwe money for Senior Week. After best effort of the year, Jumbos dropped by Falcons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Class of '00 can live off campus next year. Swastikas found in dorm hall. Oh-oh-oh-oh staying alive (men's basketball). Sixth at New englands (women's swimming). Northrop moving into Wisc. for nationals (men's track).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cause dinners are eliminated. Ex-College to hold forum on education in information age. Phone troubles delay pints off-campus. Administration works to improve retention rate for undergraduates. Team wins emotional game(women's basketball). Weekender.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Second generation meets in discussion. Senior fund grows toward its financial goal after pub night. Debate team ready for battle. Jumbos defeat Brandeis fifth in a row(Men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jumbos seeded seventh in NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] tourney. Workshop focuses on Afro-caribbean music, dancing. Oxfam vs. Curtis. Jumbos light up Camels, move onto NCAAs (men's basketball). Jumbos cannot get over hump (women's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Colleges to give new computers to faculty. Faculty votes to continue Tufts' ROTC [Reserve Officers' Training Corps] program. PAA [Pan African Alliance] appeals cut off church van. Student injured after altercation. Done celebrating, Jumbos now prepare for Corsairs (men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Week of events compose this year's Spring Fling. Jumbos capture the finale (hockey). Season ends in fine fashion (Men's swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: University will honor Congressman with degree. President discusses information technology. Rabbi Unger compares and contrasts religions. (men's track) Jumbos sweep the ECAC's [Eastern College Athletic Conference]. Women fare well individually (women's track). Major's Week: March 3-7, 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Where no Jumbo has gone before. Off-campus points start-up unknown. Computerised classroom? Sully send Jumbos to rematch at Salem State.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The end of the road. Senate declares Casino Night a 'real success'.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate discusses its progress. Senate produces the PAA [Pan African Alliance] budget. Experienced team swing for NCAA's [National Collegiate Athletic Association, Softball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Friedman to back loans bill before Mass. Senate. Tickets now available for Spring break shuttle. Freshman to play big role for upstart lacrosse team (men's lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts honors champion of biomedical research. Task force on race tackles harassment. Revised cause dinner program will be created. Weekender.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Father Hunt will leave Tufts due to diagnosis. Jumbos set to take the field [Baseball]. With this much experience, no substitutes are necessary (Women's Lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four Jumbos make All-American teams. No drinking at Sigma Nu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jodie Nealley named new head of Student Activities. CSL [Committee on Student Life] hears arguments on sQ. Meaney signed up for Comedy Show. Tought week down South 'will pay off' (Men's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A packed week for EPIIC [Education for Public Inquiry and International Citizenship]. University begins project to save water on campus. The Future od Democracy: An EPIIC International Symposium at Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Maya Angelou to speak Wednesday. Five finalists will compete for Wendell Phillips. Mountain club requests $100,000 for cabin repairs. 12 seniors to recieve alumni awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts will begin recycling its environmental policies soon. Late night at Curtis Hall. Physics professor Vilenkin wins research award. Jumbos barnstorm through the South(Baseball). Commencement 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New website Jumbohub strives for 'community'. Student activists discuss democracy at EPIIC [Education for Public Inquiry and International Citizenship]. Sociologist will lecture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Angelou cancels her speach due to storm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blizzard shuts down campus. Faculty discuss roles in higher education. Senators debate social policy. Senate discusses socially responsible investing. Jumbos trampled twice (men's lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Spring Fling acts announced. No fooling, Angelou speech is postponed. Serving of strawberries halted in school lunches. Faculty approves new minor and courses. Commencement 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TUTV [Tufts University Television] initiates broadcasting in downhill dorms. Date for Angelou lecture revised. Through clouds and rain, Tufts tracks down victory (men's track). Jumbos blow past ol' Mother Nature [women's track). Game, set match: Tufts (men's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: UN Ambassador to speak at Commencement. Conversations Project celebrates anniversary. Tufts grad, Times correspondent to speak about campaign finance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eric Pliner wins Wendell Phillips Award. Faculty unanimously pass shareholder resolutions. Future of kids TV discussed at panel. EPC [Educational Policy Committee] recommends changes to freshman writing requirement. Mixed results for men's and women's crews in first races (Crew).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: RHA loses funding. Admissions office gears up for uocoming April Open House. Ace pitcher Taglienti baffles MIT Engineers(BAseball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 450 students donate during cause dinner. Tufts women to Take Back the Night. Speakers part of Global Justice Week. Acceptance letters mailed for incoming freshmen. Bowdoin and Trinity prove too strong for the Jumbos (men's lacrosse). Unhittable pitching leads to huge wins (softball). Back in action after week off (women's lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Citing 'student leadership' DiBiaggio presents awards. Senators approve SCIRT [Student Coalition for Investor Responsibility at Tufts] resolution. Trees slow to recover from spring snow surprise. Track would like to thank Conn. College (women's track). Tennis team works through difficult stretch of matches [men's tennis.] Jumbos stop horsin' around (Equestrian).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate will be short on senior again next year. One alum's landmark case. Elshtain apeaks on danger of cynicism. Hillel lecture will address tensions in Israel. Spring Fling Week 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: University to honor astronaut. Contract renewal likely for bookstore. State of the Senate delivered.Jumbos spank Chargers(Baseball). Women's novice keep shining(Crew). Fall 1997 Course offerings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New artwork unveiled. Nine freshmen share Senate platform ideas. Nations leading sociologist discussed race and poverty issues. Jumbos hope to swing victories (men's tennis).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Future role for technology discussed during luncheon. Kids' day scheduled for this Friday. Spring Fling begins today. Eight freshmen elected to next years Senate. No Morrill:Jumbos fall to purple cows without goalie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Weather affects weekend activities. Mattox and Brenner to face off in presidential elections. There's no room to complain as housing lottery concludes. Jumbos soar despite weather (men's track). Women's track team wins second straight (women's track). Tufts splits double-header (softball). Williams, Conn. College handily defeat Jumbos by margin of 40-7 (men's Lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fired up over butterflies. Tonight is Hotung:Brenner vs. Matoxx. President hopes to improve image of Tufts Republicans. Jumbos bats' come alive(Baseball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mattox and Brenner compete in debate for TCU [Tufts Community Union] presidency. social policy at Tufts to be studied this summer. Fellowships awarded to five history professors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mattox wins TCU [Tufts Community Union] presidential election. New center will be focused on family and media environment. No Morrill? No problem! (women's lacrosse). Games important for morale (men's lacrosse).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No admission fee can be levied at Goddard. Senior garners first prize in engineering contest. Surf's up at Holy Cross track(Women's track). MIT Baffles Jumbos(men's track). Leonard carmichael Society:Connections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Astronaut Hauck receives Light on the Hill tomorrow. Debauchery on the Lawn. Maya Angelou speaks tonight. Mattox outlines initial goals. Sunday afternoon blaze. Womens lacrosse keeps NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] hopes alive. Losing streak at 11(men's lacrosse). A pair of sweet victories for the highly ranked Jumbos (Softball). Spring Fling. Semester in review-Spring 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts to confer almost 2000 degrees today. Astronaut Rick Hauck honored with third Light on Hill award. Faculty reject change in freshman writing requirement. Senate elects executive board during final meeting of the year. Carmichael scheduled for summer repairs. Senate gavel passes to Mattox. University updates its web page. [Marilyn] Glater steps down as dean. DiBiaggio discusses audit, alumni relations. Task force on rae prepares recommendations. [Rev. Michael] Hunt's departure is a loss to many friends and students. Grads bid farewell to Tufts. Seniors' long and winding road. [Tufts baseball team:] winners and still champions. [Softball] Sluggers earn first ever NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] berth, bow out early. Bouced out of [men's tennis] regionals. Jumbos tumble in [women's lacrosse] ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] heartbreaker. [men's lacrosse] looking towards the future. Rowers send three to Georgia. [Mens] Tracksters: A Force to be reckoned with. Surprising spring success [for women's track.] Four years of hard work pays dividends for [Rosalie] Ferrara. Seven Garner recognition at Captains' Luncheon. Next stop: [Sailing] Nationals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Class of 2001 matriculates today. UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] protests contract decision. Triples await new class. Tufts fall one spot in ranking of best Universities. Now on map, Jumbos look to continue growth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Workers protest hiring of new cleaning service. Students angry over changes in Tufts connection billing plan. Tufts professor receives grant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Email passwords stolen. Former UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] workers hold rally by powderhouse. Library article from home. Many students avoid shipping belongings by UPS. Father Hunt feeling better. Gun sounds early for Jumbo [women's cross country] runners. Key [football] players return this fall.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New choices foster a successful orientation. Students and TUPD differ in accounts of early morning fight. Students learn the art of meditation. With proven veteran players gone, field hockey looks to build future.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Men's rugby suspended for the fall 1997 season. Junior may press charges. Despite three resignations, Senate off to strong start. Students upset over billing. Password lessons learned. Volleyball wants to be a smash. Cross Country desires a repeat invitation to National spotlight.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Date set for Thatcher address. De La Soul set to rock campus. Students get copies of 'Times'. Mountain Club may receive additional funding. Groceries for those on the go. Soccer team is confident, ready for a strong season. Searching for Tiger Woods [Golf].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Agent describes encounter with Nazis. Neo-Nazi infiltrator set to address campus. Future not looking bright for halogen lamps. Freshmen meet before school. Shir Appeal: singing their way accross campus. Young Jumbos pick up [women's soccer] where they left off. Freshmen swing into early role for lady Jumbos [tennis].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mountain club signs over weekends for next 100 years. Return date uncertain for paralyzed proffessor. Artificial nose being created to sniff out landmines. [Men's] soccer starts off on the right foot. Runners prove to be untouchable in season debut.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Suspect has not been identified from Saturday's Sig Ep [Sigma Phi Epsilon] incident. Power outage leaves students in the dark. Jumbos head to CA looking for first [volleyball] win. [Field Hockey] Jumbos light up camels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TUPD [Tufts University Police Department] emphasizes student awareness in wake of assaults. Tufts' Friedman goes national. One man and his mission. [women's cross country] Starting on the right foot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TCU [Tufts Community Union] Senate addresses yearly turnover. FOCUS enters orientation scene. [In Women's soccer] Tufts survives scare.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspapers popular at Tufts, according to Princeton Review. TUTV [Tufts University Television] has plans to begin broadcasting this October. Cardinals run wild all over the Jumbos [football]. Talented freshmen help lead [tennis] team to three victories.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professor estimates new age of universe: 12 billion years. President offers cautious defense of fund raising. Rusty water affects Carmichael dining. Womens suffer their first [soccer] loss. Jumbos remain undefeated [men's soccer.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Over enrollment causes late deliveries at bookstore. A stunned Van Camp discusses her time at TUfts. Study abroad in Japan to begin. Fairway to Heaven: Jumbos looking good early.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Britain's Iron Lady extols democratic system. Senate and CSL [Committee on Student Life] candidates address student electorate. Prez meets the press. Fraternity put on hold. Field Hockey drops another tough game. Jumbos look to gain intensity back home. Team effort paces runners accross.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bookstore to expand in size. Executive discusses oil industry future. Eaton, Mark Labs get upgraded. Women's soccer team now 4-1. Smooth sailing, six early wins highlight young Jumbo season. Runner sshaping up for season.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Smith is winner of Leibner Award. Task force on rae plans to publish report this semester. Donation sustain scholarship fund for state's medical schools. First shuttout in two football seasons for Jumbos. The lost art of kickball.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Faculty support rehiring of displaced UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] workers. Physical education professor drowns. Jumbos get bounced by Bates. Women net fifth consecutive victory of year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TCU [Tufts Community Union] Senate no longer in charge of UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] forum. Banner year for research grants. Ernst replaces Glater as dean.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Long time educator applauded for work. Tufts tomorrow head looks at progress of campaign today. Wellesley loss hurts post-season hopes [women's soccer]. Women's field hockey at .500. Runners up to fifth in the nation. Without top runner, women still step up.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thatcher's security detail very thorough. Administrators and students address alcohol on campus. Finance reform faces obstacles. Prof. Hunter retires after 29 years of service to Tufts. Golf team not up to par at NESCAC [New England Schools and Colleges Athletic Conference] championships. Pats looking to get back to Super Bowl once again.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Crew team discovers dead body in the Charles river. Tufts, nation discuss global warming issues. [women's soccer] Jumbos tie, score respect. Tufts [women's tennis] stumbles against both rivals, Division I foes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Psychology proffesor honored with award. New England conservatory professor, viola virtuoso dies Saturday at age 82. Task force to evaluate campusLink. Jumbos [football] hoping to trample Trinity Bantams on Sunday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Student spirit is theme of this years festivities. Children are focus of forum on health. UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] discussion in Ex-college hands. It's deja vu all over again as Bowdoin [field hockey] is held scoreless. Rocky Road leads to .500 mark [for volleyball]. For the long run, [men's cross country] team looks sound. [women's cross country team] Looking to recover from loss.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boston council meets to discuss alcohol on campus. [Vee] Talmadge speaks to actors. Public safety department honored with award. Slump sends [men's] soccer skidding. Sailing holding its own.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Increase in Tuition below national rise. Professors say time travel unlikely. Fletcher graduate speaks on possible NATO enlargement. Jumbos [football] suffer tough loss.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: University to listen to Senate resolutions. Inquiry initiated by cable commission. Students take on the unknown. Grossman introduces Angela Landsbury at the White House. Despite grueling [women's soccer] game, Jumbos emerge victorious on Sunday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In wake of state crackdown, liquor stares defend record. Religion department sees faculty enlargement. [Matt] Adler's return ignites [men's] soccer squad, NESCAC [New England Schools and Colleges Athletic Conference]. [Volleyball] finding formula for success and a winning streak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1000 fewer parents expected this year. Hospital merger is nearing completion. Faculty, students support ex-UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] workers to teach in. GRE [Grand Requisite Exam] goes high-tech. Manning masters Wellesley [women;s cross counrty] course. A winning weeks for women's tennis team. Heartbreaking loss for Tufts [field hockey]. [men's cross country] Jumbos nipping on the heels of Judges.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Schools consider SCIRT [Student Coalition for Investor Responsibility at Tufts] resolution. House will vote on student consolodation today. Honors thesis provides alternative to grades. Tufts students take a stand on nuclear abolition. Shock for Jumbos [football defeat].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Art History professor [Margaret H. Floyd] dies. President DiBiaggio addresses Senate. Jumbos sail away with two trophies. [Men's] Soccer ties up with Ephmen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: U.S. diplomat talks on state of Pakistan. Tufts spends thousands on Washington Lobbying firm. TUPD is following leads in aftermath of Sept. 13 assault. Jumbos place above .500 despite defeats [in women's tennis]. Runner sput up stellar times ar the All-New England meet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Changes to Homecoming aimed to raise attendance. Committee responds to increase in LD [Learning Disabled] students. Rock and Roll legend Al Kooper leads Blues class. Tufts Alum Eden White to perform this weekend. Jumbos [football] look to dethrone heralded Lord Jeffs. Despite injuries, Altman back. Tennis' terrific two. Gearing up for [field hockey] stretch run. [In soccer,] Men hoping to engineer another victory tomorrow. For Women, [soccer] Amherst is biggest challenge of year. Always in mix, [Evan] Dabby looks to finish career strong. After slide, Jumbo spikers looking to bounce [volleyball] back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Alpha Epsilon Pi] Fraternaties and Sororities receive rating from CFS; No hot showers for Stratton residents over weekend. Homecoming football well attended despite bad weather. Kaplan score centers offer exciting career opportunities. Tufts democrats: more than just campaigning. Records can be decieving: the Jumbos [footbal] have come far. Another frustrating [football] loss.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: State of the Treasury address delivered at senate meeting. [Bud] Collins, [William G.] Grinnell honored by Tufts. Gender may not have swayed Tufts voters. Tufts [women's soccer] dominates, but falls short. Jumbos [men's soccer] triumph.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ROTC [Reserve Officers' Training Corps] visits Cape for Army training. Hebrew University professor addresses peace in Middle East. DNC [Democratic National Committee] chairman [Steve] Grossman praises grassroots politics. [Danielle] Brennan takes wind out of sails.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Patriarch brings message of peace to Ellis Oval. Hot water restored in Stratton. Sillers earns NESCAC [New England Schools and Colleges Athletic Conference] honors as Jumbos look for a few [volleyball] wins. On the threshold of NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association field hockey] tourney.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: McLennon allows same sex marriages in Goddard. Comments on courses may be on Jumbos Hub. Advisors still in demand for social science majors. Successful Jumbos one kick closer to [women's soccer] playoffs. Strong showing puts [women's] tennis back on map.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chinese president lectures at Harvard as part of US tour. High school bands compete on Ellis Oval in rain. More water troubles in Stratton. Jumbos [football] trample White Mules on Saturday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Students for labor justice seek TCU [Tufts Community Union] group status. Faculty suggests ways to improve the Tufts Tomorrow Campaign funding. Halogen retro fit kits are available. Defending ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference] [field hockey] champs denied NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] invites.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Co-Authors discuss their book on 'Atomic Bomb Conspiracy'. Tufts students reach out to community. Gloria Feldt speaks on abortion rights. Women: can't ref without 'em. Regular [women's soccer] season ends on down note; team looks to Springfield. St. Mary's Brennan takes the wind out of Tufts sailors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With its new look, TUTV [Tufts University Television] hits the air. College Pizza shuts down; competition reacts apathetically. Fifteen students are honored for freshmen year accolades. Jumbos [sailing] snatch bragging rights. Runners hit a valley. Sun shines bright on Tufts [women's soccer]. Jumbos spike their way to big [volleyball] tourney.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administration wants to boost commitment to CPC [Career Planning Center]. Mattox plans to propose Junior Trustee program. [Football] Going out with a bang. NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association, men's soccer] invitation most likely on the line tomorrow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NEMC [New England Medical Center] merger will help fund medical school. Trustees and faculty discuss state of Tufts. UC-Berkley ranks Tufts as 12th most demanding school. Defeat does not detract from successful [women's soccer] season. [Hockey] Teams hopes for NCAAs washed away Saturday. Last-second kick propels Jumbos to [football] victory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Actor, social activist [Edward James] Olmos will lecture. Tufts' social policy draws wire of Senate, fraternity members. Honoring America's veterans. [Dr. Terrell] Clark discusses sign language. Austin Pendleton to speak in Balch. [Men's soccer] Downpour by Middlebury. [Men's cross country] Gearing up for upcoming qualifying meet for nationals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A fight for the right to party. A quarter-century after Title IX, women's athletics thrive. Serving up more than assignments. Tufts' [Jon] Baker sails to second at nationals. Jumbos set to serve up some trouble at the ECAC [Eastern College Athletic Conference, volleyball] tournament.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Austin] Pendleton addresses students in theater. Cousens closed last night following an electrical fire. Study abroad numbers increase. DiBiaggio discusses Berkley rank. Jumbos hand down a harsh [men's] soccer verdict.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hip is good, as long as it is not in Harvard square. Brownsfields issue is addressed. Off to the Presses [student publications]. Borghesani prize enhances sense of world commitment. Math Club adds up fun time for all involved.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate discusses social atmosphere on campus. Intruder arrested in South Hall. Program brings minority Ph.d. candidates to speak to students.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Edward James] Olmos lectures on diversity. Modern technology is topic of lecture. Field hockey rebounds to end season on good note. Jumbos take two championships (sailing). Like fish in water (water polo).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A struggle for preservation. INQUIRY set for April seminar. Oxfam fasts to teach about world hunger. Running 'against the wind' (women's cross country). Jumbos roller-coaster season ends with a defeat in ECACs (volleyball). By slimmest of margins, runners miss Nationals (men's cross country).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Foreign policy and refugees discussed. Sign-up begins today for Turkey shuttle. Men's hoops ready to rumble (men's basketball). Jumbos look to improve on last year's 9-13 record (women's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Low pay for faculty, says AAUP data. MOPS hungry for replacement. Harsh end to a strong season (men's soccer).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate supports NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] post-season play for athletic teams. DiBiaggio reads to promote bookstore. Cultural Solidarity week will promote unity among groups. For starters, Jumbos split (men's basketball). Press and run leads to bid win in opener (women's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Repairs on gym to be completed today. TUPD [Tufts University Police Department] on heightened alert in aftermath of dorm intrusion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Making words come alive. Deputy Director of Peace Corps will speak at Tufts. Women diving into season on right note (swimming). Men start off with a huge splash by defeating Clark (swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DiBiaggio defends switch of cleaning services to ISS [International Service System.] Trustees' goals for University outlined at faculty meeting. Alpha Phi Delta volunteers in community. Hironaka lights up cats (women's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Groups call new Dewick policy racially motivated. Rugby team is frustrated yet pleased with progress. Turnovers give win to Babson (women's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Former U.S. advisor lectures on roles of science, technology. Strong group plans to jump into ECAC's [Eastern College Athletic Conference] (men's track). Jumbos follow youth into meet (women's basketball). The Greek gazette.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains issues of the Tufts Daily, the student newspaper of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hundreds of Emerald accounts locked after hackers break in. Food fights prompt end for the annual pancake breakfast. [Sol] Gittleman to undergo hip replacement surgery. Spring 1998: Experimental College Course Offerings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts and UNICCO [University Cleaning Company] hold open dialogue. Santa leaves gift for employees. Brown and Brew celebrates first birthday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Custodial controversy splits administration. Early decision applicants rise. Laundry prices increase. Tufts pledges future of nonviolence on campus. Sickness sweeps ice hockey away (hockey). Mixed bag for road warriors [women's basketball]. Intense training trip leads to solid results (men's swimming). Saints sail away with one (men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate passes change in Campuslink billing plan. Campus groups unite for nonviolence. Madoff honored. 'Cats no match for Tufts (men's basketball). Another road kill served [men's basketball]. Yound swimmers key early success (women's swimming). Bargmann leads way in first two meets for Jumbos (women's track).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Research the focus of panel. Roe vs. Wade commemorated at Wednesday's student rally. Fletcher graduate gives advice to students. Tufts drops another sixth straight loss to Vikings (men's basketball). Road-weary Jumbos victorious at home (women's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Men's group set to tackle non-violence. Senate to explain Link's new rates in response to students. Bookstore renovations on tap. Icemen gain momentum (hockey). Jumbos battle youth, injuries (squash).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engineers reach beyond Tufts. Jumbos full of heart in determined effort (swimming). Curry spiced by Jumbos (men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fraternities regain right to host parties. Religious fliers found in Jewish books at Tisch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Students to have choice over their billing plans this semester. Administrators discuss on-campus domestic violence. Jumbos starting to peak (men's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Food drive is planned to assist former custodians. Faculty addresses absence of women. Senate CPC [Career Planning Center] report ready for Trustees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nutrition school to relocate to Boston. Task force on race releases recommendation. 'Dateline' producer to speak in Pearson. TCU [Tufts Community Union] Senate holds special elections. Tapering Tufts knocks off Cats (men's swimming). Jumbos keep up season-long pace against Bates (women's swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Colleges to vote on resolution. Fire breaks out in Lewis Hall. 'Dateline NBC' producer and alum shares news experiences. TCU [Tufts Community Union] election results announced. Jumbos oust Beavers in fourth win of the season (men's basketball). Runners grab second place (women's track).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Workers file claim against University. Carribean Club's weekend. Lecture focuses on capital punishment. Jumbos skate to a late season surge (Hockey).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Challenge gift tops annual trustee lunch. Students and locals fight at Milne House. Fake ID Ring busted in Wren Hall. 'Real World' member talks. Death penalty discussed. Tufts rebounds from tough loss (men's basketball). Women's hoop burn up court (women's basketball).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: MOPS to add Ali's in place of College. Wren fake ID ring exposed. 'Marriage Proposal' presented to senate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NCAA [National Collegiate Athletic Association] decision postponed. Spring Rush ends with much success. TUTV [Tufts University Television] to air new programs. Jumbos wallow in wake of the Williams Ephmen (Swimming).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Key professors take leave. Jam is no show in Cohen. Bernstein says recognition key. Jazz show to feature Chick Corea, Burton. Panel shares views on Woodward trial. Round two applicants decrease. Best of times, worst of times (men's swimming). Springfield runs past Jumbos (women's track).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CPC [Career Planning Center] report urges immediate change. Junior dies after basketball game. New field house gets go ahead. Jumbos slip sliding away [Men's basketball]. No Lovin' on Valentine's Day [For women's basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professor's [Melvyn Colon] step-son killed in drive-by. Senate receives survey results. Tufts alum [Tara Tayor] skating for Disney. Jumbos run past [Men's track] competition on way to New Englands. Hironaka has a big night [women's basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TLGBC [Tufts Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Community] applies for group housing. EPIIC [Education for Public Inquiry and International Citizenship] symposium focuses on refugees. [Women's Track] Team faces post season hurdles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Senate to organize '70s night. Prominent Speakers address higher education Initiative. RA [resident assistant] competition heating up. In Memorium--Joseph Gonzales. Last second goal ices Jumbos [hockey].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts team thinks their way to fifth in regional College Bowl. Asian economic crisis affects students on and off campus. Professor [Jonathan Strong] to give free reading. Jumbos upset Amherst; [men's basketball] seniors shine on senior day.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New investment committee forms. Senate refers forum on campus media to MAB. Letter advocates public service. Jumbos [women's basketball] continues to skid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Students perform poorly in survey. Tufts will be represented at the Chicano conference. Marilou Awiakta will give a poetry reading tomorrow. Jumbos drop fifth in a row [women's basketball].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Class of '98 donates Fund money to CPC [Career Planning Center]. TLGBC [Tufts Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Community] says frat pledges mock them.
